dwv.image.filter.Threshold.name: dwv.image.filter.Threshold
dwv.image.filter.Threshold.description: Threshold an image between an input minimum and maximum.

dwv.image.filter.Sharpen.name: dwv.image.filter.Sharpen
dwv.image.filter.Sharpen.description: Sharpen an image using a sharpen convolution matrix.

dwv.image.filter.Sobel.description: Apply a Sobel filter to an image.

dwv.image.Size.name: dwv.image.Size
dwv.image.Size.description:
Image Size class.
Supports 2D and 3D images.

dwv.image.Spacing.name: dwv.image.Spacing
dwv.image.Spacing.description:
Image Spacing class. 
Supports 2D and 3D images.

dwv.image.Image.name: dwv.image.Image
dwv.image.Image.description:
Image class.
Usable once created, optional are:
- rescale slope and intercept (default 1:0), 
- photometric interpretation (default MONOCHROME2),
- planar configuration (default RGBRGB...).

params.name: isSigned_
params.description: Flag to know if the data is signed.

params.name: isSigned
params.description:
Is the data signed.
Need to set the window lookup table once created
(either directly or with helper methods).

dwv.math.BucketQueue.name: dwv.math.BucketQueue
dwv.math.BucketQueue.description:
Circular Bucket Queue.

Returns input'd points in sorted order. All operations run in roughly O(1)
time (for input with small cost values), but it has a strict requirement:

If the most recent point had a cost of c, any points added should have a cost
c' in the range c <= c' <= c + (capacity - 1).

params.name: x
params.description: The X coordinate for the point.

params.name: y
params.description: The Y coordinate for the point.

params.name: x
params.description: The X coordinate for the point.

params.name: y
params.description: The Y coordinate for the point.

params.description: A Point2D representing the beginning of the line.

params.name: end
params.description: A Point2D representing the end of the line.

params.name: begin
params.description: A Point2D representing the beginning of the rectangle.

params.name: end
params.description: A Point2D representing the end of the rectangle.

params.name: inputPointArray
params.description: The list of Point2D that make the path (optional).

params.name: inputControlPointIndexArray
params.description:
The list of control point of path, 
 as indexes (optional).
Note: first and last point do not need to be equal.

params.name: points
params.description: The points from which to extract the circle.
